headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; COURT OF COMMON PLEAS--MONDAY. Trial for a Diverce. SECOND DAY. COURT CALENDAR--WEDNESDAY. SUPERIOR COURT--GENERAL TERM--June. SUPREME COURT--SPECIAL TERM.--Tuesday. UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT.
Beard of Health in Secret Conclave.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: The daily papers of this City yesterday announced the fact that the Board of Health would hold a meeting to take measures to prevent the extension of an epidemic, or the spread of the cholera, c. Being somewhat interested in the subject of our city's health, and anxious to know what the authorities would do, or suggest, or discuss, , I

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; New-York and Erie Railroad. ASSAULT IN WHITEHALL-STREET. SUICIDE BY A PISTOL SHOT.- OFFICE OF THE NEW-YORK AND ERIE RAILROAD COMPANY. MURDEROUS ASSAULT ON A SEAMAN. BOY DROWNED AT STATEN ISLAND. AMERICAN TRACT SOCIETY.- City Politics. New-York Historical Society. The Walker Divorce Trial-The Letters. DISTINGUISHED MARRIAGES. DEATH BY CAMPHENE.-

docs.lead_paragraph: The Strike of Railroad Engineers. headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; General State of Public Feeling--Commercial News.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Crescent City arrived yesterday from Havana, bringing our papers and letters to the 14th of June. The following form our regular correspondent gives all the intelligence of any interest:

LONG ISLAND.; KINGS COUNTY COURT OF OYER AND TERMINER--Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: VERDICT OF THE JURY--GUILTY. Before Judges Rockwell and Morse and Justices Stilwell and Stryker. TRIAL OF JOHN CAVANAGH, COMMISSIONER OF EXCISE, FOR MISDEMHONOR. For the prosecution, R. C. Underhill, Esq., District Attorney.
docs.snippet: VERDICT OF THE JURY--GUILTY. Before Judges Rockwell and Morse and Justices Stilwell and Stryker. TRIAL OF JOHN CAVANAGH, COMMISSIONER OF EXCISE, FOR MISDEMHONOR. For the prosecution, R. C. Underhill, Esq., District Attorney.

docs.lead_paragraph: FIFTY-SEVEN deaths from Cholera are reported by the Inspector during the last week. None are surprised to hear it, and none are panie-stricken. At every step of the way this foe to our race has hung out his flag. He sent heralds to announce his coming. None were so blind as to deny that they saw evidences of the approach.
